node.title: Carole Baskin suing Netflix over her Tiger King 2 interviews
node.alt: Carole Baskin kneels in front of a lion
node.description: While Florida big cat sanctuary founder Carole Baskin has launched legal action over use of her interviews in Tiger King 2, Netflix says sheÂ and her husband agreed in writing that the material could be used in future and that she is trying to block the company's right to free speech.
node.content:
["The founder of a Florida big cat sanctuary who\u00a0features in the popular series Tiger King is suing Netflix and a production company to prevent the use of interviews and footage involving her in an upcoming sequel.", "Carole Baskin \u2014 the\u00a0founder of Big Cat Rescue \u2014 contended that Royal Goode Productions, which produced Tiger King for Netflix, led her and her husband, Howard Baskin, to believe their footage would only be used in a single documentary.", "However, Netflix says Ms Baskin and her husband agreed in writing that the material could be used in future and that she is trying to block the company's First Amendment right to free speech.", "The new season is expected to be released in the US on November 17, according to court documents.", "In their lawsuit, the Baskins said they were under the impression that the interviews they gave were for the first season of the show.", "\"The Baskins believed that any sequel, though odious, would not include any of their footage,\" the lawsuit said.", "Ms Baskin is also objecting\u00a0to her portrayal in the first series, especially the insinuation that she had something to do with the mysterious 1997 disappearance of her first husband, Don Lewis, who was declared dead in 2002 but whose remains have never been found.", "On Tuesday, Ms Baskin declined further comment but did speak to The Associated Press recently about an upcoming two-part series called, Carole Baskin's Cage Fight, intended to call attention to the problems of zoos that allow tiger petting and private ownership of the animals.", "\"We have never, ever had anybody mislead us and be so dishonest with us as the producers were of Tiger King,\" Ms Baskin told AP.", "\"And so they were just a fluke. I mean, that was not like it was our first experience and we were never going to do it again.", "\"It was like, 'OK, well, that was horrible, but that's just them. That's not the industry'.\"", "Netflix,\u00a0said\u00a0the Baskins explicitly agreed in a written release\u00a0that all their interviews and footage shot at their Tampa cat refuge could be used in future projects.", "Netflix's lawyers also said tampering with the sequel amounted\u00a0to unconstitutional prior restraint of the right to free speech and the Baskins could only sue for damages after it aired.", "\"Defendants did not need to obtain a release from plaintiffs to use the footage in Tiger King 2 or its promotion trailers,\" Netflix attorney Rachel Fugate said in court documents.", "Ms Fugate said the Baskins \"have no claim at all, much less one that can evade [the] defendants' First Amendment protections\".", "Lawyers also said in their\u00a0filing that Ms Baskin had\u00a0used the popularity of Tiger King for her own publicity purposes, even appearing on the US version of the television show Dancing With The Stars and becoming\u00a0a \"pop culture phenomenon\" because of the program.", "As of Tuesday afternoon, local time, a\u00a0Tampa federal judge overseeing the lawsuit had not issued a ruling.", "", "
Joe Exotic, real name Joe Maldonado-Passage, is in prison for trying to organise a hitman to murder Carole Baskin.(Supplied: Netflix)
", "The lawsuit is the latest twist in the saga involving Ms Baskin and Joe Exotic \u2014 real name Joseph Maldonado-Passage \u2014 who were at the centre of the documentary series Tiger King: Murder, Mayhem and Madness.", "Airing in March 2020 \u2014 just as COVID-19\u00a0pandemic restrictions forced people to stay home \u2014 the first series was immensely popular.", "Much of the series has focused on a dispute between Baskin and Maldonado-Passage over the treatment of tigers, lions\u00a0and other big cats at an Oklahoma zoo he formerly operated.", "Maldonado-Passage is in prison after being convicted of attempting to hire someone to kill Ms Baskin, a tale told in the initial series.", "An appeals court recently ruled that his 22-year prison sentence\u00a0should be reduced.", "He is being held at a federal prison in Fort Worth, Texas.", "Maldonado-Passage announced last week he had\u00a0an aggressive form of prostate cancer and he asked people to pray for him.", "AP/ABC"]
